intro: Najas flexilis var. fusiformis, commonly known as the slender water milfoil, is a submerged aquatic plant native to freshwater environments in North America. It features slender, flexible stems that can grow up to several meters in length, often forming dense underwater mats. The plant produces small, whorled leaves that are typically 2–4 mm in length, aiding in its ability to photosynthesize in low-light conditions. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, appearing in clusters near the water's surface. This species plays an important role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various aquatic organisms.
